synopsis.text: In the year 2020, Kokone Morikawa is an average high school girl living in Okayama Prefecture with her father Momotaro, a skilled mechanic. As she tries to study for her college entrance exams, Kokone keeps dozing off and having vivid dreams about a machine-driven future filled with wondrous motorized devices. Meanwhile, just days before the Tokyo Olympics are set to open, Momotaro is suddenly arrested and taken to Tokyo for questioning about stealing technology from a powerful corporation. Kokone teams up with her childhood friend Morio to try to rescue her father and get to the bottom of the mystery. As Kokone continues having strange dreams, she comes to realize they hold clues about her family's hidden past and secrets her father has tried to protect her from. The line between dreams and reality begins to blur as Kokone uncovers more pieces of the puzzle across both worlds. She discovers that in order to save her father in the real world, she must first face fantastic challenges in her dream-world. On her journey traversing dreams and reality, Kokone learns surprising revelations about her father's work and her own talents. With newfound courage and conviction, she harnesses the power of her dreams to uncover the truth and protect her family's important secret from villainous forces looming both in dreams and real life.
synopsis.author: anthropic.claude-v2:1
